t: To*pn You I will cry, O Lord*s my Rock: Do*ld not be silent to me, Lest,*ld if You are*i silent to me, I*ld become like those who go down to the pit.
Hear*ld the voice of my supplications When*ld I cry to You, When*ld I lift up my hands toward Your holy sanctuary.
Do*ln not take me away with the wicked And*ld with the workers of iniquity, Who*ld speak peace to their neighbors, But*ld evil is*i in their hearts.
Give*ld them according to their deeds, And*ld according to the wickedness of their endeavors; Give*ld them according to the work of their hands; Render*ld to them what they deserve.
Because*ld they do not regard the works of the Lord,*s Nor*ld the operation of His hands, He*ld shall destroy them And*ld not build them up.
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord,*s Because*ld He has heard the voice of my supplications!
The*ld Lord*s is*i my strength and my shield; My*ld heart trusted in Him, and I am helped; Therefore*ld my heart greatly rejoices, And*ld with my song I will praise Him.
The*ln Lord*s is*i their strength, And*ld He is*i the saving refuge of His anointed.
Save*ld Your people, And*ld bless Your inheritance; Shepherd*ld them also, And*ld bear them up forever.
